file_content.text: Our crews will be on it, as soon as they've sobered up.
The lake team said they heard you at work. Given the size of those blasts, I'm surprised we didn't down here.
Any problems detonating those bombs?
No trouble. It's more fun than trying to defuse them.
It was easy.
I wouldn't know. Sounds like your life is a bit more exciting than mine. But there's good news.
It's done. I need payment.
Hey, hey, no problem. I just wanted to give the good news first.
I think I got bit by the filthiest mouth this side of Nar Shaddaa.
I still hurt from the bites.
Yeah, you'll want to disinfect that before the rotting starts. But there's good news!
I told the Republic the swamp is clear, and they instantly gave the go. No more bureaucratic boondoggle.
Now, we'll double-time it until the pipeline is done. Those colonists are going to feel a lot better when they can afford to shower.
Remember, those demolition charges won't kill the tremor maws, but that doesn't mean you can stand next to one.
If you're here from Republic Command, don't worry, we got the message. It's too dangerous.
And if you're from the union, same thing. None of my men are working as long as those tremor maws are in the lake.
I don't know what a tremor maw is, but it doesn't sound good.
Tremor maw?
Swamp lizards the size of a speeder. We tried to build a pipeline to the lake.
You try and get the colonists a little fresh water and what happens? Deaths, dismemberments and your project shut down.
I'm not involved.
I guess so. You wouldn't believe how many people they've sent to check on us.
What's the lake got to do with this?
I don't see a lake.
Some colonies and survey camps are running out of fresh water, so we were building a pipeline from the north lake down to them.
But the machinery attracted tremor maws. One minute we're enjoying the scenery, and the next, screaming and death and the project shut down.
We exploded a few demolition charges to scare the maws off, but it just makes them want to fight. Our blasts were more like bait.
Do you need me to get you back on track?
If you need me, I'm there.
If you think you can kill these things, you're welcome to try. The demolition charges are still set up in the lake.
The Republic outpost has soldiers. Can they spare a few to kill these things?
Can't the army kill them?
You'd think, but they're the ones who told us to wait. They're exploring options. Flying water in, filters, moisture vaporators, it's nonsense.
The pipeline's our only long-term bet. Everything else, colonists can't afford. They'll start deserting soon. No money, no colony.
It's frustrating because the charges were already laid. You could flush out every tremor maw in that lake if you wanted.
How long can the colonists last without fresh water?
Will the colonists be okay?
No colonist can afford water that's flown in for long.
And it's become a pattern--the money dries up, people leave and rakghouls move into the ghost town.
What I wouldn't give for someone to just shoot those lizards. It's not like we ever removed the bait.
This colony won't fail on my watch. I'll let you put down that pipe safely.
I'll remove the tremor maws.
I wanted to say that up-front, but I didn't want to put pressure on a Jedi. It just ain't classy.
The demolition charges are in the lake. Set them to go and get way, way back. The blast will be big.
I've dealt with more reptiles than I care to remember. I'll do it.
Easy.
Ha! That's what I like. The demolition charges should be easy to spot when you get to the lake.
You show me where these monsters live, and I'll show you where they die.
Point me at them.
Now that's how it's done! Head to the lake. We've got demolition charges in the water up there.
I could do it, but I have to work for a living, too. Understand?
I'll need compensation.
Are you kidding? I learned budgeting on Hutta. We'll take care of you. Just get up to the lake where the demolition charges are.
Obviously, when you key them in to blow, don't walk--run out of the blast radius. That stuff is construction-grade detonite.
Then get ready for the fight of your life. Maws can bite through a gripper crane, let alone humanoids like us.
You do it. [Refuse quest]
Who am I going to get to kill these things, my union boys? Not likely.
Yeah, we're not working. Tell me something I don't know.
